label: Bedrock
description: The lithospheric substrate upon which all urban form rests. Determines foundation requirements and construction feasibility.

label: Soil Composition
description: Clay, sand, gravel, and marl distribution affecting drainage, load-bearing capacity, and agricultural potential.

label: Fault Lines
description: Tectonic fracture zones requiring seismic design standards and limiting certain development types.

label: Mines
description: Extraction sites and subsurface voids affecting ground stability and creating brownfield conditions.

label: Topography
description: Elevation data and terrain morphology shaping drainage patterns, views, and accessibility.

label: Slope Analysis
description: Gradient calculations determining buildability, erosion risk, and infrastructure routing.

label: Water Table
description: Subsurface aquifer levels affecting foundation design, basement feasibility, and contamination risk.

label: Wetlands
description: NWI-designated areas with development restrictions and ecological buffer requirements.

label: Flood Zones
description: FEMA-designated areas requiring insurance, elevation certificates, and resilient design.

label: Air Quality
description: Atmospheric particulate and chemical composition affecting health outcomes and HVAC design.

label: Vegetation
description: Plant cover distribution affecting microclimate, carbon sequestration, and habitat connectivity.

label: Natural Habitats
description: Protected ecosystems requiring environmental review and mitigation measures.

label: Ecological Systems
description: Interconnected biotic communities and their metabolic cycles within urban boundaries.

label: Wildfire Risk
description: FEMA-designated fire hazard severity zones affecting insurance, defensible space, and materials.

label: Strong Wind Risk
description: FEMA wind exposure zones affecting structural design loads and fenestration requirements.

label: Earthquake Risk
description: Seismic hazard zones determining structural system requirements and retrofit priorities.

label: Raw Materials
description: Extractable resources (aggregate, timber, minerals) within or near urban boundaries.

label: Agricultural Land
description: Productive soil classified for farming, often protected from urban conversion.

label: Solar Potential
description: Insolation values determining photovoltaic viability and passive design strategies.

label: Energy Grid
description: Electrical transmission and distribution network capacity and connection points.

label: Heat Islands
description: Urban thermal anomalies affecting cooling loads, health, and vegetation stress.

label: Wind Corridors
description: Natural ventilation paths affecting air quality, comfort, and wind energy potential.

label: Carbon Sinks
description: Areas with net carbon sequestration capacity (forests, wetlands, soils).

label: Material Reservoirs
description: Stockpiles and flows of construction materials (sand, steel, timber, concrete).

label: Parcels
description: Legal land divisions with unique identifiers forming the atomic unit of property rights.

label: Site Addresses
description: Geocoded location identifiers linking parcels to postal and emergency systems.

label: Site Conditions
description: Physical state assessments including contamination, demolition needs, and utility access.

label: Lot Coverage
description: Percentage of parcel area occupied by structures, determining open space compliance.

label: Boundaries
description: Legal and physical demarcations defining ownership edges and easements.

label: Basemap
description: Authoritative geographic reference layer for spatial registration of all other data.

label: Building Footprints
description: Ground-level outlines of structures defining lot coverage and floor plate geometry.

label: Building Height
description: Vertical dimension of structures measured to various datum points per code.

label: Structures
description: Physical improvements on land including buildings, walls, and permanent installations.

label: Density Measurement
description: Calculated intensity of development (units/acre, FAR achieved, people/hectare).

label: Single Family Residential
description: Detached dwelling units on individual lots with yard setbacks.

label: Multifamily Residential
description: Attached dwelling units in buildings with shared common areas.

label: Commercial Real Estate
description: Properties used for business operations, retail, and services.

label: Industrial Assets
description: Manufacturing, warehousing, and production facilities.

label: Retail Assets
description: Consumer-facing commercial spaces for goods exchange.

label: Office Buildings
description: Professional workspace structures with varying class ratings.

label: Mixed Use Development
description: Properties combining residential, commercial, and/or industrial functions.

label: Hospitality Assets
description: Hotels, motels, and short-term accommodation facilities.

label: Civic Buildings
description: Government, institutional, and public service structures.

label: Secure Sites
description: Restricted-access facilities (data centers, utilities, defense).

label: Open Space
description: Parks, plazas, and undeveloped land preserved for public or ecological use.

label: Transmission Lines
description: High-voltage electrical corridors with easement and clearance requirements.

label: Waste Management
description: Solid waste collection, transfer, and disposal infrastructure.

label: Parking Infrastructure
description: Surface lots, structures, and on-street spaces for vehicle storage.

label: Streets
description: Public rights-of-way for vehicular and pedestrian circulation.

label: Right of Way
description: Legal corridors for transportation and utility infrastructure.

label: Transit Networks
description: Fixed-route public transportation infrastructure (rail, bus, ferry).

label: Smelters
description: Metal processing facilities with environmental and zoning implications.

label: Refiners
description: Petroleum and chemical processing plants with buffer requirements.

label: Component Manufacturers
description: Facilities producing parts for assembly into finished goods.

label: Assemblers
description: Final product manufacturing facilities combining components.

label: Distributors
description: Warehousing and logistics facilities for goods movement.

label: Shipping Infrastructure
description: Ports, rail yards, and intermodal transfer facilities.

label: Curb Cuts
description: Vehicular access points from streets to parcels, regulated by code.

label: Vacant Lots
description: Unimproved parcels available for development or interim use.

label: Historic Districts
description: Designated areas with design review and preservation requirements.

label: Utility Corridors
description: Easements for water, sewer, gas, and telecommunications infrastructure.

label: Stormwater Infrastructure
description: Drainage systems, retention basins, and green infrastructure.

label: Technical Infrastructure
description: Physical backbone of digital systems including fiber, towers, and data centers.

label: Internet Infrastructure
description: Global network connectivity points and local access nodes.

label: IoT Devices
description: Internet-connected sensors, controllers, and edge devices distributed across the city.

label: Microchips
description: Processing units embedded in urban systems from traffic lights to smart meters.

label: Telecommunications
description: Voice, data, and video transmission networks (cellular, landline, satellite).

label: Network Infrastructure
description: Routers, switches, and cabling forming the digital nervous pathways.

label: Environmental Sensors
description: Devices measuring air quality, noise, temperature, and environmental conditions.

label: Urban Sensing Network
description: Distributed sensor mesh providing real-time urban condition awareness.

label: Eye-Tracking Systems
description: Visual attention monitoring for retail, safety, and user experience research.

label: Live Streams
description: Real-time video and data feeds from cameras and monitoring systems.

label: Real-Time Systems
description: Low-latency computing infrastructure for time-critical urban operations.

label: Urban Actuators
description: Controllable devices that physically modify urban conditions (gates, valves, signals).

label: Smart Home Technologies
description: Connected residential systems for comfort, security, and energy management.

label: Robotics
description: Autonomous and semi-autonomous machines performing urban tasks.

label: Embodied AI
description: AI systems with physical presence capable of sensing and acting in the environment.

label: Autonomous Vehicles
description: Self-driving cars, trucks, and shuttles navigating urban streets.

label: Drones
description: Unmanned aerial vehicles for delivery, inspection, and surveillance.

label: Edge Compute Nodes
description: Distributed processing units reducing latency for local AI inference.

label: Traffic Signals
description: Networked intersection control systems managing vehicle and pedestrian flow.

label: Smart Meters
description: Connected utility meters enabling real-time consumption monitoring.

label: Charging Stations
description: Electric vehicle charging infrastructure with grid integration.

label: Building Management Systems
description: Integrated controls for HVAC, lighting, security, and energy in structures.

label: Setbacks
description: Required distances between structures and property lines or other features.

label: Floor Area Ratio
description: Maximum buildable area expressed as ratio of floor area to lot area.

label: Zoning Regulations
description: Codified rules governing land use, density, and building form by district.

label: Detailed Controls
description: Fine-grained design standards for materials, fenestration, and articulation.

label: Height Limits
description: Maximum vertical dimensions for structures by zone or overlay.

label: Parking Requirements
description: Mandated vehicle storage ratios tied to use type and intensity.

label: System of Record
description: Authoritative data source for a given domain (e.g., parcel boundaries).

label: Master Data
description: Core reference entities (parcels, addresses, owners) used across systems.

label: Golden Record
description: Single source of truth created by reconciling multiple data sources.

label: Metadata
description: Data about data: schemas, lineage, quality scores, and access controls.

label: Data Layers
description: Thematic geospatial datasets stacked for analysis (e.g., zoning, flood, transit).

label: Transactional Data
description: Records of events and exchanges (sales, permits, violations).

label: Interaction Logs
description: Recorded user and system actions for audit and analysis.

label: Vector Stores
description: Embedding databases enabling semantic search and retrieval.

label: Structured Database
description: Relational data stores with defined schemas and query languages.

label: Semantic Database
description: Graph databases storing meaning and relationships between entities.

label: Knowledge Graph
description: Network of entities and relationships forming machine-readable knowledge.

label: Data Processing
description: Pipelines transforming raw data into analysis-ready formats.

label: Datamining
description: Pattern discovery techniques extracting insights from large datasets.

label: Data Preparation
description: Cleaning, normalization, and feature engineering for model training.

label: Data Retrieval
description: Systems for querying and fetching relevant data from storage.

label: Document Processing
description: Extraction and structuring of information from unstructured documents.

label: Document Generation
description: Automated creation of reports, permits, and legal documents.

label: Speech to Text
description: Transcription systems converting audio to written text.

label: Natural Language Processing
description: AI systems understanding and generating human language.

label: Cloud Infrastructure
description: Remote computing resources (compute, storage, networking) on demand.

label: Data Lake
description: Centralized repository for raw data in native formats.

label: Data Storage
description: Persistent media for structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.

label: Backend Resources
description: Server-side computing and database systems supporting applications.

label: Middleware
description: Software connecting applications, data, and users across systems.

label: API Layer
description: Programmatic interfaces enabling system-to-system communication.

label: Microservices
description: Modular software components performing discrete functions.

label: Compute Clusters
description: Networked processors for parallel and distributed computing.

label: Machine Learning
description: Algorithms that learn patterns from data to make predictions.

label: LLM Models
description: Large language models for text understanding and generation.

label: Model Customization
description: Fine-tuning and adaptation of AI models for specific domains.

label: Reinforcement Learning
description: AI training through reward signals and environmental feedback.

label: GraphRAG
description: Retrieval-augmented generation using knowledge graph context.

label: Prompt Engineering
description: Crafting inputs to elicit optimal AI model outputs.

label: Rules Engine
description: System executing business logic and conditional workflows.

label: Business Rules
description: Encoded organizational policies and decision criteria.

label: Application Layer
description: User-facing software providing specific functionality.

label: Constraint Objects
description: Computable representations of regulatory limits bound to parcels.

label: Void Markers
description: Flags indicating regulatory gaps where no code exists for new conditions.

label: Market Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for financial returns and investment viability.

label: Policy Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for regulatory compliance and public benefit.

label: Climate Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for environmental sustainability and resilience.

label: Infrastructure Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for system capacity and service delivery.

label: Community Agent
description: Synthetic actor representing neighborhood interests and social cohesion.

label: Health AI Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for public health outcomes and wellness.

label: Safety AI Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for crime prevention and emergency response.

label: Municipal AI Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for city operations and service efficiency.

label: Traffic AI Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for mobility flow and congestion reduction.

label: Equity Agent
description: Synthetic actor optimizing for fair distribution of benefits and burdens.

label: Agentic Architecture
description: System design patterns for autonomous AI decision-making.

label: Agent Orchestration
description: Coordination layer managing multi-agent workflows and conflicts.

label: Multi-Agent Coordination
description: Protocols for agents to negotiate, defer, and reach consensus.

label: Task Executor
description: Runtime environment executing agent-generated action plans.

label: Copilot Systems
description: Human-in-the-loop AI assistants augmenting professional judgment.

label: Action Generators
description: AI systems producing executable plans and interventions.

label: Content Generators
description: AI systems producing text, images, and media outputs.

label: Decision Making Systems
description: AI frameworks for evaluating options and selecting actions.

label: Sensemaking
description: AI processes interpreting ambiguous situations and forming narratives.

label: Probability Cones
description: Visualization of uncertain future states as branching scenarios.

label: Consensus Artifacts
description: Documented agreements between agents on contested decisions.

label: Scenario Fields
description: Spatial representations of competing urban futures.

label: Human-AI Interactions
description: Interfaces and protocols for human-agent collaboration.

label: Synthetic Ecology
description: The emergent system of interacting AI agents and their behaviors.

label: Population
description: Total count of residents within a geographic boundary.

label: Total Households
description: Count of occupied housing units as economic and social units.

label: Generational Cohorts
description: Age-based population segments (Boomers, Gen-X, Millennials, Gen-Z, Alpha).

label: Age Distribution
description: Population breakdown by age ranges affecting service demand.

label: Income Distribution
description: Spread of household incomes indicating affordability constraints.

label: Household Income
description: Aggregate earnings per housing unit driving purchasing power.

label: Gross Rent
description: Monthly rental costs including utilities in a market area.

label: Home Value
description: Assessed or market value of residential properties.

label: Real Estate Market
description: Aggregate conditions of property transactions and pricing.

label: Market Intelligence
description: Data and analysis informing investment and development decisions.

label: Market Potential
description: Estimated demand for goods, services, or development types.

label: Development Economics
description: Financial feasibility analysis for real estate projects.

label: Employment Status
description: Labor force participation and joblessness rates.

label: Human Users
description: Individual people interacting with urban systems and services.

label: Stakeholders
description: Parties with interests affected by urban decisions.

label: Human Operators
description: People managing and maintaining urban systems.

label: Analytics Users
description: Professionals consuming urban data for decision-making.

label: Civil Societies
description: Non-governmental organizations advocating for community interests.

label: Neighborhood
description: Local geographic community with shared identity and services.

label: Village
description: Small settlement with limited urban services.

label: Town
description: Intermediate settlement with basic urban amenities.

label: City Scale
description: Full urban settlement with comprehensive services and governance.

label: County Scale
description: Regional administrative unit encompassing multiple municipalities.

label: State Scale
description: Subnational jurisdiction with legislative and regulatory authority.

label: National Scale
description: Sovereign state with supreme authority over territory.

label: Social Values
description: Collectively held beliefs influencing behavior and policy preferences.

label: Cultural Dimensions
description: Measurable aspects of culture (individualism, power distance, etc.).

label: Cultural Landscape
description: Physical manifestation of cultural practices in the built environment.

label: Public Attitudes
description: Surveyed opinions on policies, technologies, and changes.

label: Public Engagement
description: Processes for citizen participation in planning and governance.

label: Advocacy Groups
description: Organizations mobilizing around specific issues or constituencies.

label: Ethical Oversight
description: Bodies and processes ensuring AI and urban systems align with values.

label: User Experience
description: Quality of interaction between people and urban systems.

label: Social Friction Index
description: Composite measure of community resistance to change.

label: Historical Shocks
description: Past traumatic events (crashes, disasters, displacement) affecting present attitudes.

label: Fear Index
description: Measurement of anxiety about future risks (job loss, climate, crime).

label: Displacement Risk
description: Probability of residents being forced to relocate due to market or policy changes.

label: Economic Memory
description: Collective recall of past economic cycles affecting current behavior.

label: Gentrification Pressure
description: Forces driving neighborhood demographic and economic change.

label: Tenant Associations
description: Organized renter groups advocating for housing stability.

label: Labor Markets
description: Supply and demand dynamics for workers by sector and skill.

label: Community Benefits
description: Negotiated public goods from development (jobs, housing, infrastructure).

label: Established Law
description: Enacted statutes and ordinances with binding legal force.

label: Tort Law
description: Legal framework for civil wrongs and liability claims.

label: Legislation
description: Proposed and enacted laws from legislative bodies.

label: Compliance
description: State of conformity with applicable rules and standards.

label: Enforcement
description: Actions to ensure adherence to laws and regulations.

label: Litigation Risk
description: Probability and potential impact of legal challenges.

label: Rights and Interests
description: Legal entitlements and claims attached to property or persons.

label: Permissions
description: Granted authorizations to perform specific actions (permits, licenses).

label: Governance Systems
description: Structures and processes for collective decision-making.

label: Neo-Governance
description: Emerging forms of governance incorporating AI and networked actors.

label: Regulatory Governance
description: Rule-based oversight of specific sectors or activities.

label: AI Regulatory Authority
description: Bodies with jurisdiction over artificial intelligence systems.

label: International Organizations
description: Multilateral bodies coordinating cross-border policy (UN, WTO).

label: Supranational Bodies
description: Institutions with authority above nation-states (EU).

label: Urban Planning
description: Professional practice of guiding city development and land use.

label: Spatial Planning
description: Coordination of land use across regional and metropolitan scales.

label: Land-Use Planning
description: Process of designating permitted activities for parcels.

label: Zoning Districts
description: Geographic areas with uniform land use and development rules.

label: Zoning Overlays
description: Additional regulations applied over base zoning (historic, flood, TOD).

label: Land Use
description: Actual or permitted activity occurring on a parcel.

label: Density Bonuses
description: Allowed increases in development intensity in exchange for public benefits.

label: Public Finance
description: Government revenue and expenditure affecting urban investment.

label: Taxation
description: Compulsory contributions funding public services and infrastructure.

label: Public Access
description: Rights of citizens to use public spaces and information.

label: Public Records
description: Government documents available for citizen inspection.

label: Assessor Data
description: Official property valuations for taxation purposes.

label: Qualified Census Tracts
description: Designated areas eligible for specific federal programs.

label: Opportunity Zones
description: HUD-designated areas with tax incentives for investment.

label: Difficult Development Areas
description: HUD zones with higher tax credit allocations.

label: School Districts
description: Geographic boundaries for public education governance.

label: Jurisdictions
description: Territorial boundaries of governmental authority.

label: Ethical Framework
description: Principles guiding AI and urban decision-making.

label: Guardrails
description: Safety constraints preventing harmful AI actions.

label: Transparency
description: Requirements for disclosure of decisions and processes.

label: Accountability
description: Mechanisms for assigning responsibility for outcomes.

label: Social Regulations
description: Rules governing behavior and interactions among people.

label: Environmental Regulations
description: Rules protecting natural systems and limiting pollution.

label: Policy-as-Code
description: Machine-readable and executable regulatory logic.

label: Contested Regime
description: Governance model prioritizing pluralism and litigation.

label: Directed Regime
description: Governance model prioritizing state-led coordination and efficiency.

label: Legacy Governance
description: Historical institutional arrangements persisting into present.
